text: In a 46,XY American subject with complete 17-alpha-hydroxylase/17,20-lyase deficiency (202110), Costa-Santos et al. (2004) identified homozygosity for a 4-bp deletion, TTTT, near the 3-prime end of intron 3 of the CYP17A1 gene. RNA derived from the TTTT deletion skipped exon 4 entirely, deleting 29 amino acids in-frame; cells expressing the mutant gene had no 17-hydroxylase activity. The diagnosis in the patient had been based on extremely elevated 11-deoxycorticosterone and corticosterone values, and failure of pubertal progression
